source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
t. 
 
Measures to prevent pre-eclampsia 
• The following may help to reduce the chance of a women getting pre-eclampsia: 
• Calcium supplementation to all pregnant women: 
o 1 gram elemental calcium in divided doses (e.g. calcium carbonate, oral, 500 mg 12 hourly or 1 g in the 
morning). 
• For women at high risk of pre-eclampsia, e.g. pre-eclampsia in a previous pregnancy, chronic hypertension or 
diabetes: 
o Aspirin 150mg taken at bedtime (at night – to prevent gastric irritation) from 6 week
